title: Intentions for the Week
description: Intentions for the Week- Week 20 in 2025 Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 20! How was your weekend? Did you have any time to yourself? (I spent most of the weekend with my boys) Did you get to rest? (I had some chill time on Sunday) Did you do meal prep? (I relaxed cuz Mother’s Day!) Do you know what’s for dinner tonight? I think we might have shrimp! Crispy Salt & Pepper Shrimp Here are my Intentions for the Week: Intentions this Week This week’s intentions: Mind/Body morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracy’s tracking tools post recipe finish binder class stuff announce class SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. Box Home grocery shop put away winter clothes finish cleaning out prop closet organize my office paper piles laundry dishtowels plant things litterboxes weed whack hill leaf blow deck water indoor plants go through pantry compost/worm bin clean kitchen clean bathrooms clear off stairs clear off dining room table vac stairs clean out car straighten up garage refill pill case garbage/recycling Last Week’s Intentions: Mind/Body morning pages/ morning routine 30 minutes no screen after wakeup fill out my Intentions for the week calendar keep track of what I eat in my food journal keep track of movement on Apple watch move body daily- break a sweat breath work work in Currently workbook check-in with calendar art time floss daily horoscope connect with my spirit work in my hobonichi cousin outdoor time/hike? pull cards/journal/video watch how much time I spend on the phone tweeze things paint nails do a hair treatment clean house + phone a friend use my diffuser eating meeting steam facial take vitamins stay hydrated read before bed quality time with my cats get enough sleep Work: intentions for the week i love lists record stuff my everyday life tracy’s tracking tools post recipe finish binder class checkout announce class SELF Check In! upload/edit photos recipe testing work on Currently Workbook work on THC clean up office package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club (THANK YOU!) catch up pinning on my Pinterest account Tailwind catch up on social media clean up workspace bookkeeping/pay bills emails go to P.O. Box Home grocery shop put away winter clothes finish cleaning out prop closet organize my office paper piles laundry dishtowels wash blankets plant things litterboxes weed whack hill leaf blow deck water indoor plants go through pantry compost/worm bin clean kitchen clean bathrooms clear off stairs clear off dining room table vac stairs clean out car straighten up garage refill pill case garbage/recycling Posts to Inspire Chilaquiles Mexican Pizza Bean + Cheese Taquitos Mushroom & Caramelized Onion Quesadillas Mexican Popcorn Coconut Cake with Berries & Cream Blueberry Limeade If you make a recipe from Shutterbean, tag me on Instagram! I’d love to see your creations! Here’s a mood: Mantra for the week! Feeling stuck? Make a list! Write down your intentions for the week to help hold you accountable for action. My Intentions for the Week Calendar can help!! You can start it at any time of the year! I also have a printable if you work well with a one-sheet. Here it is in a binder. It’s part of my Time Management Printable pack! Need extra help? Join my accountability group: SELF-CHECK-IN We spend Sunday mornings 9:00 AM PST-10:30 AM- PST working on our calendars and checking in together. Those are my Intentions for the Week! Wishing you a productive week. Take good care of YOU! The post Intentions for the Week appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Intentions for the Week is a weekly TO DO list series on Shutterbean.com, created by Tracy Benjamin of The Handwriting Club. What started as a personal planning ritual turned into a structured planner designed to help you organize your week with intention, creativity, and accountability. Follow along every Monday for inspiration, productivity tips, and a space to map out your goals!

html:
Intentions for the Week- Week 20 in 2025

Hi hiiiiii! Welcome to week 20!  How was your weekend? 

Did you have any time to yourself? (I spent most of the weekend with my boys)

Did you get to rest?  (I had some chill time on Sunday) 

Did you do meal prep? (I relaxed cuz Mother’s Day!) 

Do you know what’s for dinner tonight?  I think we might have shrimp!

Crispy Salt & Pepper Shrimp

Here are my Intentions for the Week: 

Intentions this Week 

This week’s intentions: 

Mind/Body

  • morning pages/ morning routine
  • 30 minutes no screen after wakeup
  • fill out my Intentions for the week calendar
  • keep track of what I eat in my food journal
  • keep track of movement on Apple watch
  • move body daily- break a sweat
  • breath work
  • work in Currently workbook
  • check-in with calendar 
  • art time
  • floss daily
  • horoscope
  • connect with my spirit 
  • work in my hobonichi cousin
  • outdoor time/hike?
  • pull cards/journal/video
  • watch how much time I spend on the phone
  • tweeze things
  • paint nails
  • do a hair treatment
  • clean house + phone a friend
  • use my diffuser
  • eating meeting
  • steam facial
  • take vitamins 
  • stay hydrated 
  • read before bed
  • quality time with my cats
  • get enough sleep

Work:

  • intentions for the week 
  • i love lists 
  • record stuff
  • my everyday life
  • tracy’s tracking tools 
  • post recipe
  • finish binder class stuff
  • announce class
  • SELF Check In! 
  • upload/edit photos
  • recipe testing
  • work on Currently Workbook 
  • work on THC
  • clean up office
  • package/ship orders for The Handwriting Club  (THANK YOU!)
  • catch up pinning on my Pinterest account
  • Tailwind
  • catch up on social media
  • clean up workspace 
  • bookkeeping/pay bills
  • emails 
  • go to P.O. Box

Home

  • grocery shop
  • put away winter clothes
  • finish cleaning out prop closet
  • organize my office
  • paper piles 
  • laundry 
  • dishtowels
  • plant things
  • litterboxes
  • weed whack hill
  • leaf blow deck
  • water indoor plants 
  • go through pantry 
  • compost/worm bin
  • clean kitchen
  • clean bathrooms
  • clear off stairs
  • clear off dining room table
  • vac stairs
  • clean out car
  • straighten up garage 
  • refill pill case
  • garbage/recycling

Mind/Body

  • morning pages/ morning routine

  • keep track of what I eat in my food journal

Posts to Inspire

Chilaquiles 

Mexican Pizza 

Bean + Cheese Taquitos 

Mushroom & Caramelized Onion Quesadillas

Mexican Popcorn

Coconut Cake with Berries & Cream 

Blueberry Limeade

If you make a recipe from Shutterbean, tag me on Instagram! I’d love to see your creations! 

Here’s a mood: 

Mantra for the week!

Feeling stuck? Make a list! Write down your intentions for the week to help hold you accountable for action. 

My Intentions for the Week Calendar can help!!   You can start it at any time of the year!

I also have a printable if you work well with a one-sheet. Here it is in a binder. 

It’s part of my Time Management Printable pack! 

Need extra help? Join my accountability group:

SELF-CHECK-IN

We spend Sunday mornings 9:00 AM PST-10:30 AM- PST working on our calendars and checking in together. 

Those are my Intentions for the Week! 

Wishing you a productive week. Take good care of YOU!
